list_definition.definition: to throw out (the contents of the stomach or other matter) through the mouth; to be sick

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Whenever the ship started to move, she felt like vomiting.

list_definition.definition: food etc ejected from the stomach

list_ex_of_english: Perceptions of presenting symptoms ranged from painful though not an emergency, to severe pain or vomiting requiring urgent attention.
The production of viral aerosols and airborne transmission following vomiting have been suggested [15-17].
The additional symptoms could be diarrhoea, vomiting, nausea, fever, abdominal pain, abdominal cramps, blood in the stool, or mucous in the stool.
Side effects included hypertension, hypotension, fever, vomiting, diarrhoea and urticaria.
Other symptoms are also common, such as lethargy, poor feeding, vomiting and failure to thrive.
Symptoms included diarrhoea, fever, stomach cramps and vomiting in 88, 60, 54 and 21 % of cases identified.
Table 3 shows attack rates for classes grouped by the number of episodes of vomiting occurring within the relevant classrooms.
Classes were grouped according to the number of vomiting episodes which occurred within the classroom and attack rates calculated for each group.
